# NOTE: Please cite original publication, online resource and date accessed when using this data.
# If there is no publication information, please cite Investigator, title, online resource and date accessed.
#
# Description/Documentation lines begin with #
# Data lines have no #
#
# Online_Resource: http://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/paleo/study/18615
# Original_Source_URL: ftp://ftp.ncdc.noaa.gov/pub/data/paleo/contributions_by_author/tierney2015/tierney2015tex86.txt

# Archive: Paleoceanography
#---------------------------------------
# Contribution_Date
#    Date: 2015-06-23
#---------------------------------------
# Title
#    Study_Name: TEX86 Surface Sediment Database
#---------------------------------------
# Investigators
#      Investigators: Tierney, J.E.; Tingley, M.P.
#---------------------------------------
# Description and Notes
#       Description: Global database (version 1.0) of modern sediment observations of the TEX86 temperature proxy, an index that describes 
#	the relative cyclization of marine archaeal glycerol dialkyl glycerol tetraethers.
#       Provided Keywords: paleoceanography, SST, ocean temperatures, proxy calibration
#---------------------------------------
# Publication
# Authors: Jessica E. Tierney and Martin P. Tingley
# Published_Date_or_Year: 2015-06-23
# Published_Title: A TEX86 surface sediment database and extended Bayesian calibration
# Journal_Name: Scientific Data
# Volume: 2
# Issue: 
# Pages: 
# Report Number: 150029
# DOI: 10.1038/sdata.2015.29
# Online_Resource: http://www.nature.com/articles/sdata201529
# Abstract: Quantitative estimates of past temperature changes are a cornerstone of paleoclimatology. For a number of marine sediment-based proxies, the accuracy and precision of past temperature reconstructions depends on a spatial calibration of modern surface sediment measurements to overlying water temperatures. Here, we present a database of 1095 surface sediment measurements of TEX86, a temperature proxy based on the relative cyclization of marine archaeal glycerol dialkyl glycerol tetraether (GDGT) lipids. The dataset is archived in a machine-readable format with geospatial information, fractional abundances of lipids (if available), and metadata. We use this new database to update surface and subsurface temperature calibration models for TEX86 and demonstrate the applicability of the TEX86 proxy to past temperature prediction. The TEX86 database confirms that surface sediment GDGT distribution has a strong relationship to temperature, which accounts for over 70% of the variance in the data. Future efforts, made possible by the data presented here, will seek to identify variables with secondary relationships to GDGT distributions, such as archaeal community composition.
#---------------------------------------
# Funding_Agency
#    Funding_Agency_Name: 
#    Grant:

# Southernmost_Latitude: -90.0
# Easternmost_Longitude: 180.0
# Westernmost_Longitude: -180.0
# Elevation: 
#---------------------------------------
# Data_Collection
#   Collection_Name: Tierney2015TEX86
#   First_Year: 100
#   Last_Year: 0
#   Time_Unit: Cal. Year BP
#   Core_Length: 
#   Notes: 
#---------------------------------------
# Chronology: 
#---------------------------------------
# Variables
# Data variables follow that are preceded by "##" in columns one and two.
# Variables list, one per line, shortname-tab-longname components (9 components: what, material, error, units, seasonality, archive, detail, method, C or N for Character or Numeric  data)
## core_name	name of the sediment core sample,,,,,,,,C
## core_type	type of core and/or coring device used. Key: BC: box core; GBC: giant box core; GC: gravity core; GGC: giant gravity core; KC: karsten core; MC: multi core; SC: slow  core; SMG: Smith-McIntyre grab sample; grab: grab sample; PC: piston core; JPC: jumbo piston core; MEG: mega core; MINI: mini core,,,,,,,,C
## sample_depth_start	depth in sediment core at which sample was taken, starting depth,,,cm,,Paleoceanography,,,N
## sample_depth_end	depth in sediment core at which sample was taken, ending depth,,,cm,,Paleoceanography,,,N
## longitude	decimal degrees, east positive, west negative,,,decimal degrees,,Paleoceanography,,,N
## latitude	decimal degrees, north positive, south negative,,,decimal degrees,,Paleoceanography,,,N
## depth	site depth,,,m below sea surface,,Paleoceanography,,,N
## tex86	the measured TEX86 index,,,fraction defined from 0-1,,Paleoceanography,,,N
## WOA09_SST	sea-surface temperature, from the World Ocean Atlas 2009 (Locarnini et al., 2010).,,,degrees C,,Paleoceanography,,,N
## OISST_SST	sea-surface temperature, from the NOAA daily Optimum Interpolation Sea Surface Temperature (OISST) product (Reynolds et al. 2007).,,,degrees C,,Paleoceanography,,,N
## WOA09_subT	sub-surface temperature, gamma average from 0-200 meters, from the World Ocean Atlas 2009,,,,,Paleoceanography,,,N
## fGDGT_0	fractional abundance of GDGT-0,,,fraction defined from 0-1,,Paleoceanography,,,N
## fGDGT_1	fractional abundance of GDGT-1,,,fraction defined from 0-1,,Paleoceanography,,,N
## fGDGT_2	fractional abundance of GDGT-2,,,fraction defined from 0-1,,Paleoceanography,,,N
## fGDGT_3	fractional abundance of GDGT-3,,,fraction defined from 0-1,,Paleoceanography,,,N
## fGDGT_cren	fractional abundance of crenarchaeol,,,fraction defined from 0-1,,Paleoceanography,,,N
## fGDGT_cren'	fractional abundance of crenarchaeol regioisomer,,,fraction defined from 0-1,,Paleoceanography,,,N
## reference_name	name of reference where data was originally published (Author et al. (year), Journal),,,,,Paleoceanography,,,C
## reference_link	url link to reference,,,,,Paleoceanography,,,C
#------------------------

# Data lines follow (have no #)
# Data line format - tab-delimited text, variable short name as header
# Missing Value: -999
